    Our Team

    Photo credit: Unsplash

    MAILAB NTNU

    Multimedia and Artificial Intelligence Lab at National Taiwan Normal University, focusing on computer vision, machine learning, and signal processing.

    • Taipei, Taiwan
    • Email
    • GitHub

    Faculty

    Prof. Jane Chen

    Lab Director, Professor

    Prof. Chen leads the MAILAB with expertise in computer vision and deep learning. Her research focuses on developing novel algorithms for visual understanding in real-world applications.

    Email Google Scholar

    Prof. Michael Wang

    Associate Professor

    Prof. Wang specializes in machine learning and multimedia analysis. His research interests include multimodal learning, reinforcement learning, and human-computer interaction.

    Email Google Scholar

    Research Staff

    Dr. Sarah Kim

    Postdoctoral Researcher

    Dr. Kim's research focuses on efficient neural networks for edge devices and real-time computer vision applications.

    Dr. David Lee

    Postdoctoral Researcher

    Dr. Lee works on medical image analysis using deep learning, with a focus on segmentation and classification tasks.

    Dr. Emily Chang

    Research Associate

    Dr. Chang develops novel self-supervised learning approaches for image and video understanding.

    Graduate Students

    Robert Zhang

    PhD Candidate

    Robert is researching vision-language models for cross-modal understanding and generation.

    Jennifer Lin

    PhD Student

    Jennifer works on multimodal fusion techniques for video analysis and activity recognition.

    Thomas Wu

    Master's Student

    Thomas is developing neural networks for 3D scene understanding and reconstruction.

    Lisa Huang

    Master's Student

    Lisa is working on attention mechanisms for efficient image and video processing.

    Alumni

    PhD Graduates

    • Dr. Alex Johnson (2023) - Now Assistant Professor at National Taiwan University
    • Dr. Michelle Chen (2022) - Now Research Scientist at Google Research
    • Dr. Kevin Liu (2021) - Now Senior AI Engineer at NVIDIA

    Master's Graduates

    • Sophia Wang (2024) - Now PhD Student at Stanford University
    • Jason Chen (2023) - Now Machine Learning Engineer at Microsoft
    • Amy Lin (2023) - Now Computer Vision Engineer at MediaTek
    • Brian Kuo (2022) - Now AI Researcher at Academia Sinica

    Join Our Team

    We are always looking for talented and motivated students and researchers to join our lab. If you're interested in computer vision, machine learning, and multimedia analysis, check out our opportunities.
